sentences.en: But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would none of me.
sentences.cn: 无奈我的民不听我的声音. 以色列全不理我.

sentences.en: But to be learned is good if they hearken unto the counsels of God.
sentences.cn: 然而,如果他们听从神的忠告,那有学问则是好事.

sentences.en: Come, ye children, hearken unto me: I will teach you the fear of the LORD.
sentences.cn: 众弟子阿，你们当来听我的话。 我要将敬畏耶和华的道教训你们。

sentences.en: Gate of the Vanquisher of all Evil Spells, Hearken and Open!
sentences.cn: 一切邪咒征服者之门, 聆听并开启!

sentences.en: Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.
sentences.cn: 你们当侧耳听我的声音，留心听我的言语。

sentences.en: Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.
sentences.cn: 请你们听我的辩论，留心听我口中的分诉。

sentences.en: Hearken , hearken, shoo's cursing on'em!'muttered Joseph, towards whom I had been steering.
sentences.cn: “听,听, 她在诅咒他们! ” 约瑟夫咕哝着, 我刚才一直都在朝着他的方向走.

sentences.en: Hearken to this, O Job! Stand and consider the wondrous works of God!
sentences.cn: 约伯啊! 你且侧耳细听这事, 立着沉思天主的奇事!

sentences.en: Hearken unto this , O Job : stand still , and consider the wondrous works of God.
sentences.cn: 14约伯阿,你要留心听, 要站立思想神奇妙的作为.

sentences.en: Howbeit they did not hearken, but they did after their former manner.
sentences.cn: 40他们却不听从, 仍照先前的风俗去行.

sentences.en: If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked.
sentences.cn: 君王若听谎言, 他一切臣仆都是奸恶.

sentences.en: If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.
sentences.cn: 你若明理，就当听我的话，留心听我言语的声音。

sentences.en: KJV Give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.
sentences.cn: [新译]你们要侧耳听我的声音, 留心听我的话.

sentences.en: KJV Mark well , O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.
sentences.cn: [新译]约伯啊, 你当留心听我,当默不作声, 我要说话.

sentences.en: Lioness, Queen of the Battle, Hearken and Remember!
sentences.cn: 母狮,战争之后, 聆听并记住!

sentences.en: The household went to bed; and I' too anxious to lie down, opened my lattice and put my head out to hearken, though it rained: determined to admit them in spite of the prohibition, should they return.
sentences.cn: 全家都去睡了，我急得躺不住，便把我的窗子打开，伸出头去倾听着，虽然在下雨，我决定只要是他们回来，我就不顾禁令，让他们进来。

sentences.en: We must hearken the prophet's call.
sentences.cn: 我们必须听从先知的呼.
